description: Test your knowledge of scientific concepts and discoveries

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.explanation: Gold's chemical symbol Au comes from the Latin word 'aurum', meaning gold.

questions.question: Which planet has the most moons?
questions.explanation: Saturn has 83 confirmed moons, the most in our solar system.

questions.question: Electrons are smaller than atoms.
questions.explanation: Electrons are subatomic particles and are much smaller than atoms.

questions.question: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
questions.explanation: Diamond is the hardest known natural material on Earth, scoring 10 on the Mohs scale of mineral hardness.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a type of electromagnetic radiation?
questions.explanation: Sound waves are mechanical waves that require a medium to travel through, unlike electromagnetic radiation.

questions.question: Which of the following are noble gases? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Helium, Neon, and Argon are noble gases, characterized by their full outer electron shells and chemical inertness.

questions.question: What is the main function of mitochondria in a cell?
questions.explanation: Mitochondria are often called the 'powerhouse of the cell' because they generate most of the cell's supply of ATP, used as a source of energy.

questions.question: What element has the atomic number 6?
questions.explanation: Carbon has 6 protons in its nucleus, giving it an atomic number of 6.

questions.question: Which scientist proposed the theory of general relativity?
questions.explanation: Albert Einstein published his theory of general relativity in 1915, which describes gravity as a geometric property of space and time.

questions.question: What is the smallest unit of life that can replicate independently?
questions.explanation: Cells are considered the basic unit of life as they can reproduce independently and carry out all the functions necessary for life.
